catalog_info.title: Readings in American Intellectual History
catalog_info.description: This course examines classic texts in American intellectual history from 1630 to the present, both primary and secondary, and surveys recent developments in the field. It is intended for first- and second-year graduate students preparing for general exams in history and for other graduate students in fields such as American Civilization, Government, Law, Literature, Religion, and Education.  Students must complete both terms of this course (parts A and B) within the same academic year in order to receive credit.
